reviews.review_msg: I have taken SA 363, 358, and now 345 all online, and I feel that 345 is the easiest and most interesting of the 3. The course is composed of 2 short papers, an essay, and a final, and as such, there are very few assignments to worry about. Most weeks require little to no work. Readings are difficult, and are not explained, but are interesting.
One of my favourite profs at SFU, wonderful course content and literature. Learned a lot. Thanks Parin!

Parin is a wonderful professor full of insight which challenges the way many things, such as "race" are constructed. I was recommended her by a friend who I was losing hope in finding a good prof at SFU. Lots of group work, lots of (interesting) reading, lots of discussion. I plan to take more courses with her in the future.

Took by distance learning. Material is kind of boring and slanted. If you stick to the script and write your papers accordingly then you'll do fine. The final exam was only 2 straightforward questions but you will end up writing a lot but it will pay off.

i have no comments about parin, i am taking an online course with her. the TA amie maclean is straight out of hell. she marks so hard and makes stupid remarks on assignments, without explaining her unhelpful comments. never take a class esp with that TA.
expect to do tons of group work, her directions are often vague, but an easy enough class. some interesting discussions
